response: narrative=Ashley Evans went missing from Greenside Street, Alloa, amid signs of a relationship breakdown at home. Known for an interest in a hermit lifestyle, Ashley was last seen near a small hotel on Greenside Street. It is believed he found solace in isolation after an argument with his brother, Gordon Burton. His friend Justin Evans and Charlotte Harrison alerted authorities. Police traced Ashley to Earl's Road, Grangemouth, where he was found safe but shaken.

narrative=Ashley Evans was last reported missing after he failed to return home from an after-school program near 43 Union Road, FK1 4PG. It was noted by a friend that he had expressed interest in exploring an old barn located nearby. Concerns grew when he didn't arrive at a local motel on 17 Whitehouse Road, Stirling, FK7 7XX, where he was expected for a community event. narrative=Ashley Evans experienced a relationship breakdown and developed an interest in a hermit lifestyle. After leaving his home at Greenside Street, he was eventually traced by a member of the public at a college near 24 Munro Road, Stirling, FK7 7UU, where he was found safe.

narrative=Ashley Evans was last seen after attending an after-school program near his home on Greenside Street. Known to have an interest in a hermit lifestyle, Ashley often sought solitude and ventured into quiet places. On the day of his disappearance, Ashley did not return home, and his absence went unnoticed until the next morning when his mother discovered he was missing. Concerned about his solitary tendencies, Ashley's brother searched familiar secluded spots, but with no success. After several days, Ashley was traced by police to Park Avenue. It was determined he had been staying alone, exploring and embracing his love for a quiet, self-sufficient existence away from the bustling world, which aligned with his known behavioral patterns.

narrative=Ashley Evans was reported missing from his home on Greenside Street, Alloa. Known to have experienced a relationship breakdown at home, Ashley had shown interest in a more secluded, hermit lifestyle. On the day of his disappearance, Ashley had a heated argument with his brother, which may have prompted him to leave. He was last seen by a colleague of his mother near a cafe at 1 Garrison Place, Falkirk, FK1 1AA. Subsequent sightings placed him on Kenilworth Drive, FK2 9LH. Despite the family's concern, and his grandfather's involvement in the search, the police eventually located him at Park Avenue, FK2 9LG. Ashley was safe but had been avoiding contact, trying to find peace away from familiar surroundings.

narrative=Ashley Evans, age 12, was last seen leaving a study group with his friend Justin Evans near Bruce Street, Alloa. It was reported that they initially intended to visit a nearby skate park, but Ashley diverged from the plan, mentioning his interest in exploring an old barn located off Kirk Entry Bo'ness Road, Falkirk. Concern arose when Ashley failed to return home, prompting a search. He was eventually found by his family on Park Avenue after spending several hours inadvertently locked in the barn, unharmed but shaken by the experience.

narrative=Ashley Evans was last seen at a barn near his home in Alloa, where he often visited with his friend. Earlier that day, he had been at college, which was unusual for him as he was still in school. Afterward, he had mentioned wanting to explore the old barn nearby. When he failed to return home, his grandfather, James Stone, grew concerned and began searching for him, contacting all of Ashley’s friends. A tip led them to a nearby hotel, often frequented by students. Ultimately, the search concluded fruitlessly until he was located at a gym facility at a workplace in Falkirk. Police traced his whereabouts after tracking communication between Ashley and his friend.

narrative=Ashley Evans was last seen at the barn on West Lodge Gardens, Alloa, FK10 2HX, following a heated argument with a close friend. Witnesses reported that the disagreement was centered around personal issues, an apparent relationship breakdown that seemed to have deeply affected Ashley. As the argument escalated, Ashley was seen leaving the area visibly upset. His grandfather, who tried reaching out to Ashley multiple times, grew concerned when he received no response. Lindsey Parker, a family friend, mentioned that Ashley often found solace in secluded spaces, making the barn a plausible last sighting. Despite initial concerns, authorities considered the risk level low due to Ashley's familiarity with the area. After several days of searching, Ashley was traced by the police to a residence on Kemper Avenue, Falkirk, unharmed.

narrative=Ashley Evans had been experiencing strain due to a recent relationship breakdown within his family, which had been affecting his demeanor at home. On the day he went missing, an argument erupted between Ashley and his brother, prompting him to leave his home on Greenside Street, Alloa. Concerned by his abrupt departure, his mother was unable to reach him, leading to increasing worry. Ashley was later traced to 1 Goosecroft Road, Stirling, after an extensive search by the police. It was suggested that he had sought solace in the familiarity of Stirling, where he had visited previously with his family. Fortunately, Ashley was found in good health and returned home, where efforts were made to address the underlying familial issues.

narrative=Ashley Evans, interested in a hermit lifestyle, went missing after leaving a friend’s barn on Blackston Road, Avonbridge. His grandfather, concerned, reported him missing. He was eventually found safe at his workplace on 4 Brown Street, FK1 4QF.

narrative=A 14-year-old named Ashley Evans, who had shown an increasing interest in a hermit lifestyle, was last seen near their workplace at 12 Fountain Road, Bridge of Allan, FK9 4ET. Their disappearance was unusual due to the sudden lack of communication with close friends and family. Ashley's grandfather mentioned visiting a barn on Haypark Road, Denny, FK6 5JZ, a frequent retreat for Ashley, but found no sign of him there. Concern increased when neither his brother nor friend Leah could make contact. The search extended to a nearby hotel located at 14 The Meadows, Stirling, FK9 5AE. Despite initial uncertainty, police traced Ashley a few days later at Earl's Road, Grangemouth, FK3 8UZ, resolving the worrying situation without incident.
